page.title: 09THE CIVIC SOCIETY
page.content: {"Put the heart back into Ealing" was the phrase used by the Ealing Alliance Group which was started in 1967. Mrs Anthony, a member of{Ealing {Civic Society,}told us that the Council's original plans for Ealing Centre included concrete towers, six rows of traffic through Mattock Lane and the demolition of part of the Uxbridge Road. { { The{Civic Society}and other groups made a plan which was right for Ealing. The Alliance group won their fight against the Council's plans. Now people are moving into the area again. { Mrs Anthony said, "If you think something is right stick to it. In Ealing what people say matters."
